sentences.en: Mars, Venus and the other planets move in eccentric orbits.
sentences.cn: 火星 、 金星及其他行星沿不正圆的轨道运行.

sentences.en: The festival of Venus was at hand.
the high surface temperatures of Venus
The Romans worshiped her as Venus.
sentences.cn: 罗马人叫她维纳斯,对她非常崇拜.

sentences.en: This painting depicts the birth of Venus.
sentences.cn: 这幅画描绘的是维纳斯的诞生。

sentences.en: Venus can be seen with [ by ] the naked eye.
sentences.cn: 金星可用肉眼 [ 裸眼 ] 看到.

sentences.en: Venus has more titles, but Serena is hot on her heels.
sentences.cn: 维纳斯虽然拥有更多冠军头衔, 但瑟琳娜正紧追在后.

sentences.en: Venus has the distinction of spinning " backward " on its axis.
sentences.cn: 金星具有沿主轴反向自转的特性.

sentences.en: Venus is of the same size as Earth.
sentences.cn: 金星跟地球差不多一样大.

sentences.en: Venus was a goddess worshiped by the Romans.
sentences.cn: 维纳斯是罗马人所崇拜的女神.

sentences.en: Venus was a goddess worshipped by the Romans.
sentences.cn: 维纳斯是罗马人信奉的女神.

sentences.en: Venus, blanketed more effectively, remains more heat.
sentences.cn: 金星被覆盖得更严密, 保留了更多的热量.

sentences.en: Venus, Earth, and other planets also perturb Mercury's motion.
sentences.cn: 金星, 地球和其他行星也使水星的运动受到摄动.

sentences.en: When the Venus de Milo was entire, there were arms on the statue.
sentences.cn: 维纳斯塑像完整时, 是有胳膊的.

trans.tran_cn: 金星，太白星，维纳斯（爱与美的女神），美女，色情
trans.tran_en: the planetthat is second in order from the Sun
